meanings.definition: A person who is habitually inactive or lazy.
meanings.sent1: The sluggards in the group always avoided doing any work.
meanings.sent2: The teacher scolded the sluggards for not completing their assignments.
meanings.sent3: The sluggards decided to take a nap instead of helping with the chores.
meanings.sent4: The garden was overrun by sluggards, refusing to pull out the weeds.
meanings.sent5: The sluggards lounged on the couch all day, ignoring their responsibilities.

meanings.sent1: The sluggards snail made its way across the garden.
meanings.sent2: The traffic on the highway was moving sluggards due to the accident.
meanings.sent3: The sluggards sloth took its time climbing up the tree.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed sluggards, barely moving at all.
meanings.sent5: The sluggards turtle inched its way towards the pond.
